ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I received a lot of practice with various grammar concepts and various vocabulary. I got to practice speaking and writing in Spanish frequently.
I learned how to speak Spanish, specifically learned more about various tenses and cultures!
I improved my Spanish grammar and conversation skills, while learning several tenses in the language.
I vastly improved my Spanish language and culture skills through constant practice and well-constructed feedback.
Developed a deeper understanding of Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The workload for this class is not too high. However, there is a lot of busy work in the form of repetitive and tedious grammar activities or reflections. Sometimes, the activities for asynchronous days take a while (definitely more than the 50 minutes of class time). I thought having required LinguaMeetings was very helpful as it allowed me to practice speaking in Spanish in a low-pressure environment, but with constructive feedback. The tests were at times challenging and unpredictable.

This course teaches you a lot in a very short amount of time. I think that more feedback on the asynchronous assignments would be very helpful. I got nearly the same grade on every asynchronous assignment throughout the semester but never really knew how to improve. The course honestly had an ungodly amount of work  so much so that I felt like it hindered my learning progress. We shouldn't have to do online activities, an asynchronous activity, a weekly language meeting and study for an exam all at once.

Weaknesses: the course is very fast paced, there is an overwhelming amount of daily homework
Strengths: The material is engaging

Strengths were many, particularly the group projects and constant class engagement. I would suggest that midterm participation feedback should be handed back sooner in the year. It was handed back very late with not much time to improve.
There is a lot of work, lots of little assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes to fulfill a language requirement and learn basic Spanish.
You're probably taking this class to fulfill your language requirement, so you have to take it!
Yes, because the course improved my Spanish and was manageable
